TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi beforefieldinit MicrosoftLanguageTokenizer extends Microsoft.Azure.Search.Models.Tokenizer

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig specialname rtspecialname instance void .ctor() cil managed

Docs.summary: Initializes a new instance of the MicrosoftLanguageTokenizer class.

MemberSignature.Value: public MicrosoftLanguageTokenizer (string name, Nullable<int> maxTokenLength = null, Nullable<bool> isSearchTokenizer = null, Nullable<Microsoft.Azure.Search.Models.MicrosoftTokenizerLanguage> language = null);

.method public hidebysig specialname rtspecialname instance void .ctor(string name, valuetype System.Nullable`1<int32> maxTokenLength, valuetype System.Nullable`1<bool> isSearchTokenizer, valuetype System.Nullable`1<valuetype Microsoft.Azure.Search.Models.MicrosoftTokenizerLanguage> language) cil managed

Docs.param: The name of the tokenizer. It must only contain letters, digits, spaces, dashes or underscores, can only start and end with alphanumeric characters, and is limited to 128 characters.

The maximum token length. Tokens longer than the maximum length are split. Maximum token length that can be used is 300 characters. Tokens longer than 300 characters are first split into tokens of length 300 and then each of those tokens is split based on the max token length set. Default is 255.
A value indicating how the tokenizer is used. Set to true if used as the search tokenizer, set to false if used as the indexing tokenizer. Default is false.

The language to use. The default is English. Possible values include: 'bangla', 'bulgarian', 'catalan', 'chineseSimplified', 'chineseTraditional', 'croatian', 'czech', 'danish', 'dutch', 'english', 'french', 'german', 'greek', 'gujarati', 'hindi', 'icelandic', 'indonesian', 'italian', 'japanese', 'kannada', 'korean', 'malay', 'malayalam', 'marathi', 'norwegianBokmaal', 'polish', 'portuguese', 'portugueseBrazilian', 'punjabi', 'romanian', 'russian', 'serbianCyrillic', 'serbianLatin', 'slovenian', 'spanish', 'swedish', 'tamil', 'telugu', 'thai', 'ukrainian', 'urdu', 'vietnamese'
Docs.summary: Initializes a new instance of the MicrosoftLanguageTokenizer class.
Gets or sets a value indicating how the tokenizer is used. Set to true if used as the search tokenizer, set to false if used as the indexing tokenizer. Default is false.

Gets or sets the language to use. The default is English. Possible values include: 'bangla', 'bulgarian', 'catalan', 'chineseSimplified', 'chineseTraditional', 'croatian', 'czech', 'danish', 'dutch', 'english', 'french', 'german', 'greek', 'gujarati', 'hindi', 'icelandic', 'indonesian', 'italian', 'japanese', 'kannada', 'korean', 'malay', 'malayalam', 'marathi', 'norwegianBokmaal', 'polish', 'portuguese', 'portugueseBrazilian', 'punjabi', 'romanian', 'russian', 'serbianCyrillic', 'serbianLatin', 'slovenian', 'spanish', 'swedish', 'tamil', 'telugu', 'thai', 'ukrainian', 'urdu', 'vietnamese'

Gets or sets the maximum token length. Tokens longer than the maximum length are split. Maximum token length that can be used is 300 characters. Tokens longer than 300 characters are first split into tokens of length 300 and then each of those tokens is split based on the max token length set. Default is 255.
